subject: The painting
sentence: The painting resembled a famous masterpiece.
paragraph: In the gallery, many artworks were displayed. Visitors admired the collection. The painting resembled a famous masterpiece. It captured everyone's attention. People discussed its origin.

subject: The new car
sentence: The new car cost a small fortune.
paragraph: The showroom was busy that day. People were eyeing the latest models. The new car cost a small fortune. Few could afford it. Some even took photos.

subject: The employees
paragraph: The company had a town hall meeting. Many issues were addressed. The employees trust the management. They felt optimistic about the future. Some had questions but were assured.

subject: The scientist
paragraph: In the conference, new ideas were shared. Many took notes. The scientist believes the theory. He found it promising. Some agreed while others debated.

subject: The proposal
paragraph: The board reviewed several documents. Some were approved. The proposal lacks clarity. It needed revisions. Feedback was provided for improvements.

subject: The teacher
paragraph: During the lesson, students were actively participating. Exercises were completed. The teacher noticed the mistake. She corrected it immediately. Students took note for future reference.

subject: The project
paragraph: The team held a meeting to discuss progress. Some aspects were on track. The project needs more resources. Efforts were made to allocate funds. Deadlines were adjusted accordingly.

subject: The child
paragraph: At the family gathering, relatives exchanged stories. Photos were displayed on a screen. The child resembles his father. People commented on the likeness. It became a topic of conversation.

subject: The residents
paragraph: Dark clouds gathered over the horizon. News updates warned of severe weather. The residents fear the storm. They began preparing their homes. Emergency kits were checked and stocked.

subject: The student
paragraph: In class, topics were meticulously covered. Many students asked questions. The student understands the concept. She raised her hand to answer. The teacher appreciated her effort.

subject: The audience
paragraph: The theater was packed with eager spectators. Lights dimmed as the show began. The audience saw the performance. Applause erupted at the end. Many discussed it enthusiastically afterward.

subject: The community
paragraph: An important meeting was held at the town hall. Many gathered to express concerns. The community respects its leaders. They listened attentively to proposals. A sense of unity prevailed.

subject: The detective
paragraph: The crime scene was carefully examined. Evidence was collected and reviewed. The detective knows the suspect. He had encountered him in past cases. Connections were drawn from previous investigations.

subject: The children
paragraph: The park was bustling with activity. Parents chatted while kids played. The children like the playground. They laughed and ran around. Swings and slides were their favorite.

subject: The passengers
paragraph: The train station was crowded during rush hour. Commuters waited patiently. The passengers heard the announcement. It informed them of a delay. Plans were quickly adjusted.
